subject: Computational Materials Physics
title: Computergestützte Materialphysik (TUM, Module NAT3031)
description: Modern theoretical/computational methods to calculate material properties from atomic structure: many-body foundations, Hartree–Fock, density-functional theory (DFT/TDDFT), many-body perturbation theory, ab-initio molecular dynamics, phonons, defects, charge/ion transport, and machine-learning approaches. Workload 300 h (~90 h contact assumed), 10 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Egger, David. Language: EN.

goals.title: Computational Materials Physics – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner understands core ab-initio and computational methods (DFT/TDDFT, HF, many-body perturbation, MD, transport, ML) to predict and interpret material properties from atomic structure.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands core ab-initio and computational methods (DFT/TDDFT, HF, many-body perturbation, MD, transport, ML) to predict and interpret material properties from atomic structure.

goals.title: Many-Body Foundations & HF
goals.description: Learner can explain the many-body problem, Hartree–Fock method, and adiabatic approximations as a basis for electronic-structure methods.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain the many-body problem, Hartree–Fock method, and adiabatic approximations as a basis for electronic-structure methods.

goals.title: DFT, TDDFT & MBPT
goals.description: Learner can describe DFT and TDDFT formalisms, connect to many-body perturbation theory, and discuss strengths/limitations for materials.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe DFT and TDDFT formalisms, connect to many-body perturbation theory, and discuss strengths/limitations for materials.

goals.title: Phonons, Defects & Vibrations
goals.description: Learner can compute/interpret phonons, vibration spectra, and defect calculations within ab-initio frameworks.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can compute/interpret phonons, vibration spectra, and defect calculations within ab-initio frameworks.

goals.title: Molecular Dynamics
goals.description: Learner can explain and apply force-field and ab-initio molecular dynamics for materials, including adiabatic approximations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain and apply force-field and ab-initio molecular dynamics for materials, including adiabatic approximations.

goals.title: Charge & Ion Transport
goals.description: Learner can describe charge/ion transport models (band theory, ballistic, modern methods) and their computational treatment.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe charge/ion transport models (band theory, ballistic, modern methods) and their computational treatment.

goals.title: Machine Learning for Materials
goals.description: Learner understands basic ML concepts and applications for materials modeling, recognizing strengths and limitations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands basic ML concepts and applications for materials modeling, recognizing strengths and limitations.

descriptionEn: Modern theoretical/computational methods to calculate material properties from atomic structure: many-body foundations, Hartree–Fock, density-functional theory (DFT/TDDFT), many-body perturbation theory, ab-initio molecular dynamics, phonons, defects, charge/ion transport, and machine-learning approaches. Workload 300 h (~90 h contact assumed), 10 ECTS, offered in winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Egger, David. Language: EN.
